sentences.english: That summer, I could see why the Czar sent his men to give her a prize.
sentences.chinese: 在那個夏天，我明白沙皇爲什麼要派人來給她頒獎了。

sentences.english: 1547- Ivan the Terrible was crowned Czar of Russia.
sentences.chinese: 1547年的今天，伊凡雷帝加冕爲俄國沙皇。

sentences.english: As for the Czar government, the transformation of Counter-Jew policy had its profound reason.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇政府對猶政策的轉變有其深刻的原因。

sentences.english: S. pay czar will give Benmosche leeway on pay.
sentences.chinese: 美國“薪酬沙皇”將對他網開一面。

sentences.english: The U.S. pay czar willgive Benmosche leeway on pay.
sentences.chinese: 美國“薪酬沙皇”將對他網開一面。

sentences.english: 1727 - Peter II becomes Tsar of Russia.
sentences.chinese: 1727年的今天，彼得二世成爲俄羅斯的沙皇。

sentences.english: It was built by Czar Ivan the Terrible in the mid-16th century.
sentences.chinese: 它是由“恐怖的沙皇伊凡”於16世紀中葉所建。

sentences.english: Which country was ruled by tsars?
sentences.chinese: 哪個國家曾被沙皇統治過？

sentences.english: The last copper copekcs of Tsarist Russia were minted in 1916.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇俄國的最後一批銅製戈比鑄於1916年。

sentences.english: Red Square has always been a central gathering place, even in the days of the Czars.
sentences.chinese: 即使是在沙皇政權時期，紅場也向來都是中心聚集地。

sentences.english: So the Amber Room became part of the Czar's winter palace in St Petersburg.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，琥珀屋就成了沙皇在聖彼得堡冬宮的一部分。

sentences.english: After leaving the chapel the Czar inspected the chapter library.
sentences.chinese: 離開教堂後，沙皇參觀了教堂圖書館。

sentences.english: The tsarist government closed down the newspaper in December 1905.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇政府在1905年12月查封了這家報館。

sentences.english: The idea of plunder, murder, and regicide !
sentences.chinese: 是的，搶奪謀殺殺死沙皇的思想。

sentences.english: A tsar was a living icon, invested with deep historical and religious significance.
sentences.chinese: 沙皇曾是活着的聖像，具有深遠的歷史和宗教意義。

sentences.english: Theczarina was polite but was definitely not amused.
sentences.chinese: 女沙皇彬彬有禮，但無疑並不愉快。

definition: Yekaterina or Ekaterina (name)/Catherine the Great or Catherine the Second (1684-1727), Empress of Russia
Marco Polo (1254-c. 1324), Venetian trader and explorer who traveled the Silk road to China, author of Il Milione (Travels of Marco Polo)
Tsarist Russia/abbr. for 沙皇俄國|沙皇俄国[Sha1 huang2 E2 guo2]
Genghis Khan (1162-1227), founder and ruler of the Mongol Empire
